pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:0.5: 26. The training rule on robe-cloth for a group
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.2: a family that was supporting the nun Thullanandā said to her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.3: “Venerable, we’re going to give robe-cloth to the Sangha of nuns.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.5: “You’re very busy,” and she created an obstacle for them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.6: Soon afterwards the house of that family burned down.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.7: They then complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.8: “How could Venerable Thullanandā create an obstacle for our gift?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.9: Now we have neither possessions nor merit.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.10: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.11: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.12: “How could Venerable Thullanandā create an obstacle for a group to get robe-cloth?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.13: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.16: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.18: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:1.19.1: ‘If a nun creates an obstacle for a group to get robe-cloth, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.6: the Sangha of nuns is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.8: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be assigned to another.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.10: if she creates an obstacle with the thought, “What can be done so that these people don’t give robe-cloth?”, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.11: If she creates an obstacle for another requisite, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1.12: If she creates an obstacle for a number of nuns or for a single nun or for someone who is not fully ordained to get robe-cloth or another requisite, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.2: if she can show a benefit in obstructing them;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.4: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.2.5: The sixth training rule is finished.
